TopicTitle: How do i calculate the surface gravity of a planet?

Articles.Content:
So i'm playing Universe Sandbox 2, and i remember the original Ubox having a feature that tells you surface gravity.

However, Ubox2 does not have this, and, giving only planetary radius and mass, how can i calculate surface gravity with only those 2 parameters?

the equation would be

Where G is the gravitational constant (6.67x10-11), m1 is the mass of the planet and r is the radius of the planet. Use a value of 1 for m2 and that'll give you how many newtons of force act on a 1kg mass.

Using the figures for earth (roughly) m1 would be 5.98x1024kg, r would be 6.38x106m.

Thereforre F for an m2 value of 1 would be = (6.67x10-11 x 5.98x1024) / (6.38x106)2

F = 9.799 N

(fairly accurate, depending on the quality of the planet mass / radius information you have)
